input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris
checks_range.25: Attending a fashion week in Paris

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

I was particularly excited about a new collaboration with a local architectural firm, which could lead to some groundbreaking advancements in sustainable urban design. Meanwhile, at home, my wife and I were busy organizing the kids' schedules for the upcoming school year. We signed them up for various extracurricular activities, including soccer, art classes, and music lessons. The evenings were spent helping them with their homework and preparing healthy meals. The week ended on a high note with a family dinner, where we shared stories of our week and looked forward to the adventures that the new year would bring.

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 03), my wife (birthday on December 20), my child_1 (birthday on November 30), my child_2 (birthday on September 29), my child_3 (birthday on January 15), 
2) Participating in a desert trek in Morocco in week 51-52.

3) Explore new cafes and restaurants every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
The second week of the year was filled with a flurry of activity, both at work and at home. At the lab, we were deep into the planning stages of the new projects, with brainstorming sessions and design meetings taking place daily. I was particularly excited about a new collaboration with a local architectural firm, which could lead to some groundbreaking innovations in sustainable urban design. Meanwhile, at home, the kids were gearing up for their annual school talent show, which was scheduled for the weekend. They spent hours rehearsing their acts, from dance routines to musical performances. My wife and I were proud of their dedication and enthusiasm. The week was also marked by a sudden thaw, with temperatures rising above freezing for the first time in weeks. The snow began to melt, turning the streets into a slushy mess. Despite the inconvenience, the sudden shift in weather brought a sense of renewal and optimism. The evenings were spent indoors, catching up on some much-needed rest and relaxation. I took the opportunity to experiment with some new recipes in the kitchen, trying out some exotic spice blends and flavor combinations.

Meanwhile, at home, the kids were in the thick of their school projects, with deadlines looming and reports due. My wife and I spent the evenings helping them with their research and editing their presentations. The week was also marked by some unexpected weather changes, with temperatures dropping once again and a fresh layer of snow covering the ground. The sudden shift in weather brought a sense of calm and tranquility, with the quiet winter landscape providing the perfect backdrop for some much-needed reflection and introspection. The evenings were spent cozied up by the fireplace, with the kids reading their favorite books and my wife and I catching up on some much-needed rest.

Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

input:
Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 9 for tailor and custom dressmaking use.
  - Designate Floor 13 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 48 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 23 for art gallery use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 79 to 83 for a corporate headquarters for a major company.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Floor 1:
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.
 Floor 2:
This floor is dedicated to a state-of-the-art fitness center, equipped with the latest cardio and strength training machines. The floor also includes a yoga and Pilates studio, sauna, and steam room, providing a comprehensive wellness experience for residents and employees.
 Floor 3:
This floor is designated for a daycare center, offering a safe and nurturing environment for children of working parents. The center includes spacious play areas, a quiet room for naps, and a kitchen for preparing nutritious meals.
 Floor 4:
This floor is allocated for a conference room, designed to accommodate large meetings and presentations. The room features advanced audiovisual equipment, adjustable lighting, and a large table that can seat up to 50 people.
 Floor 5:
This floor is dedicated to a technology hub, providing a collaborative workspace for startups and entrepreneurs. The hub includes high-speed internet access, private offices, and a shared workspace area with modern amenities.
 Floor 6:
This floor is designated for a housekeeping and maintenance team, ensuring the cleanliness and upkeep of the skyscraper. The team includes janitors, engineers, and technicians, all equipped with the latest tools and equipment.
 Floor 7:
This floor is allocated for a mailroom and package delivery service, providing a convenient and secure location for residents and employees to receive their mail and packages.
 Floor 8:
This floor is designated for a security control room, where a team of security personnel monitors the building's access points, surveillance cameras, and emergency response systems.
 Floor 9:
This floor is designated for tailor and custom dressmaking use. The floor includes private fitting rooms, a spacious workroom, and a showroom for displaying finished garments.
 Floor 10:
This floor is allocated for a storage room, providing a secure location for residents and employees to store their belongings.
 Floor 11:
This floor is designated for a housekeeping storage room, where the housekeeping team stores their cleaning supplies and equipment.
 Floor 12:

input:
Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for real estate agency use.
  - Designate Floor 77 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 71 for language school use.
  - Designate Floor 18 for veterinary clinic use.
  - Designate Floor 49 for retail store use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 3 to 9 for a advanced technology and research institute.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Floor 1:
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.
 Floor 2:
This floor is dedicated to house the building's maintenance and engineering team, ensuring the smooth operation of the skyscraper's systems. The floor is equipped with state-of-the-art tools and machinery, allowing the team to efficiently address any maintenance issues that may arise.
 Floor 3 to Floor 9:
These floors are allocated for an advanced technology and research institute. The institute is designed to foster innovation and collaboration, with open floor plans and ample natural light. Each floor houses various research labs, equipped with the latest technology and tools to facilitate groundbreaking discoveries.
 Floor 10:
This floor is designated for a high-end fitness center, offering a comprehensive range of facilities to cater to the wellness needs of the building's residents and tenants. The fitness center features a modern gym, a yoga and Pilates studio, a sauna, and a swimming pool with a stunning view of the city.
 Floor 11:
This floor is dedicated to a fine dining restaurant, offering an exquisite dining experience for the building's residents and tenants. The restaurant features an open kitchen, allowing diners to watch their meals being prepared by skilled chefs. The menu offers a diverse range of international cuisines, ensuring there's something for everyone.

This floor is allocated for a spacious conference center, designed to accommodate large-scale events and meetings. The conference center features multiple meeting rooms, a grand ballroom, and state-of-the-art audiovisual equipment to facilitate productive and engaging events.

This floor is dedicated to a rooftop garden, offering a tranquil and serene space for the building's residents and tenants to unwind and connect with nature. Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 75 for conference room use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for office use.
  - Designate Floor 64 for legal services use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 35 for veterinary clinic use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 49 to 54 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The shrimp are succulent and sweet, while the cocktail sauce adds a tangy, spicy kick.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The earthy flavor of the mushrooms is beautifully complemented by the savory, aromatic cheese filling.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. The rich, velvety sauce clings to the tender lobster meat, creating a luxurious and indulgent dish.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The crispy skin gives way to juicy, flavorful meat, while the sweet orange glaze adds a delightful contrast.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The subtle garlic flavor adds depth and complexity to the classic dish, making it a perfect accompaniment to the rich main courses.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The glaze adds a touch of sweetness and a beautiful sheen to the carrots, making them a delightful and colorful addition to the meal.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. The velvety texture and intense chocolate flavor make this a decadent and indulgent dessert that is sure to satisfy any sweet tooth.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. The coffee-infused ladyfingers are soft and spongey, while the creamy mascarpone cheese adds a rich, velvety texture.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. Our sommelier will be happy to help you choose the perfect pairing for your meal.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both comforting and nourishing, perfect for the cold winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Tomato Soup: A classic, hearty tomato soup served with a grilled cheese sandwich. The rich, savory soup is the perfect base for the gooey, melted cheese and crispy bread.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, savory dip made with spinach, artichokes, and a blend of cheeses. Served with warm pita bread, it's a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Stroganoff: Tender strips of beef cooked in a rich, savory sauce with mushrooms, onions, and sour cream. Served over egg noodles, it's a hearty and comforting dish.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A classic comfort food dish featuring tender chicken, vegetables, and a flaky, buttery crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Creamy mashed sweet potatoes seasoned with a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg. The subtle sweetness and warm spices make this a delicious and comforting side dish.
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Crispy green beans tossed in a buttery almond sauce. The crunchy almonds add texture and flavor to the tender green beans.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with tart apples, a crispy oat topping, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Chocolate Cake: A rich, decadent chocolate cake topped with a creamy chocolate frosting.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A warm, rich, and indulgent hot chocolate made with real chocolate and milk.
5.2) Mulled Wine: A festive and warming drink made with red wine, spices, and fruit.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week, we celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' with a special Grilled Salmon dish.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: Fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil drizzled with balsamic glaze. The sweet, juicy tomatoes, creamy mozzarella, and fragrant basil make for a delicious and refreshing appetizer.
1.2) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with a tomato, garlic, and basil mixture. The crispy bread, savory tomatoes, and fragrant basil make for a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon fillets grilled to perfection and served with a lemon butter sauce. The tender, juicy salmon is complemented by the tangy, buttery sauce.
2.2) Quinoa Salad: A light, refreshing salad made with quinoa, vegetables, and a citrus vinaigrette.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled to perfection and seasoned with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3.2) Quinoa Pilaf: A flavorful pilaf made with quinoa, vegetables, and herbs.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Lemon Tart: A tangy, sweet lemon tart with a crispy, buttery crust.
4.2) Fresh Fruit Salad: A colorful and refreshing fruit salad made with a variety of seasonal fruits.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp, refreshing white wine to complement the light, refreshing flavors of the meal.
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing, cooling iced tea to quench your thirst.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both hearty and flavorful, perfect for a cozy dinner at home.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spinach and Feta Dip: A creamy, savory dip made with spinach, feta cheese, and garlic. Served with pita chips, it's a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
1.2) Stuffed Jalapeno Peppers: Jalapeno peppers stuffed with a savory cheese and breadcrumb filling, baked until golden. The spicy peppers are balanced by the rich, savory filling.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A classic French dish featuring tender beef, mushrooms, onions, and a rich, flavorful red wine sauce.
2.2) Chicken Parmesan: Breaded and fried chicken cutlets topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Tender Brussels sprouts roasted to perfection and seasoned with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3.2) Garlic Mashed Cauliflower: A delicious and healthier alternative to mashed potatoes, made with cauliflower and garlic.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Brownies: Rich, fudgy chocolate brownies topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Cheesecake: A classic dessert made with a creamy, tangy cheesecake filling and a graham cracker crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A bold, flavorful red wine to complement the rich, savory flavors of the meal.
5.2) Milkshake: A delicious and indulgent milkshake made with your choice of ice cream flavor.

5.2) Mulled Cider: A festive and warming drink made with apple cider, spices, and a hint of brandy.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Soup and Salad Midweek.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, warm dip made with spinach, artichoke hearts, and garlic, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Chicken Alfredo: Tender chicken breast smothered in a creamy Alfredo sauce, served over pasta.
2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna: Layers of pasta, vegetables, and cheese baked to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Caesar Salad: Romaine lettuce topped with croutons, parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing.
3.2) Minestrone Soup: A hearty vegetable soup filled with beans, pasta, and vegetables.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm, sweet dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Cheesecake: A rich, velvety cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and a tangy lemon topping.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the savory flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Lemonade: A refreshing, tangy lemonade to complement the lighter flavors of the appetizers and salads.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with tomatoes, garlic, basil, and mozzarella.
1.2) Crab Cakes: Delicate crab cakes made with jumbo lump crab meat, served with a tangy remoulade sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A classic French dish made with tender beef, red wine, onions, carrots, and mushrooms.
2.2) Vegetarian Paella: A flavorful Spanish rice dish filled with vegetables, saffron, and paprika.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Green Beans Almondine: Crispy green beans coated in a browned butter and almond sauce.
3.2) Garlic Roasted Potatoes: Roasted potatoes tossed in garlic and olive oil, served crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Crème Brûlée: A rich, creamy dessert topped with a caramelized sugar crust.
4.2) Chocolate Brownies: Fudgy, decadent chocolate brownies served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Merlot: A smooth, full-bodied red wine to complement the rich flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing, bubbly beverage to cleanse the palate between courses.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in lime juice, mixed with tomatoes, onions, and cilantro.
1.2) Spinach and Feta Phyllo Triangles: Triangles of phyllo dough filled with spinach, feta cheese, and onions, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Coq au Vin: Chicken cooked in red wine, bacon, mushrooms, and onions, served over mashed potatoes.
2.2) Vegetarian Stuffed Bell Peppers: Bell peppers stuffed with rice, beans, corn, and cheese, baked until tender.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Corn on the Cob: Grilled corn on the cob slathered with butter and sprinkled with salt.
3.2) Quinoa Salad: A light, refreshing salad made with quinoa, vegetables, and a citrus vinaigrette.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Lemon Tart: A tangy, sweet dessert made with a lemon curd filling and a buttery pastry crust.
4.2) Chocolate Chip Cookies: Warm, gooey chocolate chip cookies served with a glass of cold milk.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Pinot Noir: A light, fruity red wine to complement the lighter flavors of the appetizers and side dishes.
5.2) Milk: A classic, comforting beverage to enjoy with the desserts.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Deviled Eggs: Hard-boiled eggs filled with a savory, spiced filling and topped with paprika.
1.2) Bruschetta with Avocado: Toasted bread topped with mashed avocado, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and balsamic glaze.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Wellington: A classic British dish made with tender beef, wrapped in puff pastry and served with a red wine sauce.
2.2) Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie: A hearty vegetarian pie filled with vegetables, lentils, and a savory gravy.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until tender and caramelized, served with a drizzle of balsamic glaze.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Creamy mashed sweet potatoes seasoned with cinnamon and nutmeg.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Cheesecake with Raspberry Sauce: A rich, velvety cheesecake topped with a tangy raspberry sauce.
4.2) Apple Crisp with Vanilla Ice Cream: A warm, sweet dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Cabernet Sauvignon: A bold, full-bodied red wine to complement the rich flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing, caffeine-free beverage to enjoy between courses.
 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Baked Brie with Cranberries: A wheel of brie cheese baked until melted and served with cranberries and crackers.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a savory breadcrumb mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Coq au Vin Blanc: Chicken cooked in white wine, bacon, mushrooms, and onions, served over egg noodles.
2.2) Vegetarian Ratatouille: A colorful, flavorful vegetable stew made with eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, and tomatoes.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Roasted Asparagus: Roasted asparagus tossed in garlic and olive oil, served crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
3.2) Quinoa Salad with Avocado: A light, refreshing salad made with quinoa, avocado, vegetables, and a citrus vinaigrette.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Lava Cake: A rich, decadent dessert with a molten chocolate center, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Fruit Tart: A sweet, tart dessert filled with seasonal fruits and a tangy custard filling.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Chardonnay: A smooth, buttery white wine to complement the rich flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Sparkling Water with Lime: A refreshing, bubbly beverage to cleanse the palate between courses.
 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a tangy cocktail sauce, accompanied by cocktail sauce and lemon wedges.
1.2) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves drizzled with balsamic glaze.

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'random of Year Party' on 11-06 with a special dish: Gourmet Cheese Platter.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 08-31 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
2) Feature 'Squash and Pumpkin Delights' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Pumpkin Pie.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 9, serving: Gourmet Burgers.

Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that are hearty and warming, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and melted cheese, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, slow-cooked stew made with beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with a crispy crumb topping.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A rich, nutty pie made with pecans, corn syrup, and a flaky pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the hearty main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm, comforting drink made with rich chocolate and milk.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features dishes that are light and refreshing, perfect for those looking to detox after the holiday season.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with salt, perfect for a light and healthy snack.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: A healthy and flavorful dish made with fresh salmon, seasoned with lemon and herbs, and grilled to perfection.
2.2) Quinoa Salad: A hearty and nutritious salad made with quinoa, vegetables, and a tangy vinaigrette.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled until slightly charred and seasoned with olive oil and salt.
3.2) Brown Rice: A simple and healthy side dish made with steamed brown rice.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Fruit Tart: A delicious dessert made with a tart shell and fresh fruit, topped with a sweet glaze.
4.2) Sorbet: A refreshing and light dessert made with fruit and sugar, served in scoops.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Green Tea: A healthy and refreshing drink made with hot water and green tea leaves.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A light and bubbly drink perfect for those looking to avoid alcohol.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features dishes that are spicy and bold, perfect for those looking to add some excitement to their meals.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spicy Tuna Roll: A classic sushi roll made with spicy tuna, avocado, and cucumber, topped with masago and spicy mayo.
1.2) Jalapeno Poppers: Fried jalapeno peppers stuffed with cream cheese and bacon, served with a ranch dipping sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chicken Vindaloo: A spicy Indian dish made with chicken, potatoes, and a complex blend of spices.
2.2) Shrimp Curry: A flavorful and spicy dish made with shrimp, coconut milk, and a variety of spices.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Naan Bread: A soft and fluffy Indian bread perfect for soaking up the flavors of the curries.
3.2) Basmati Rice: A fragrant and aromatic rice dish that complements the bold flavors of the main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chai Tea Pudding: A rich and creamy pudding made with chai tea, milk, and sugar.
4.2) Mango Sticky Rice: A sweet and sticky dessert made with mango and rice, flavored with coconut milk and palm sugar.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Mango Lassi: A refreshing and sweet drink made with mango, yogurt, and sugar.
5.2) Spicy Bloody Mary: A bold and spicy cocktail made with vodka, tomato juice, and a variety of spices.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
This week's menu features dishes that showcase the delicious flavors of squash and pumpkin.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Pumpkin Soup: A creamy and comforting soup made with pumpkin, onions, and cream.
1.2) Roasted Squash Quesadilla: A delicious quesadilla filled with roasted squash, cheese, and cilantro.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Pumpkin Ravioli: A classic Italian dish made with pumpkin-filled ravioli, browned in butter, and served with a sage brown butter sauce.
2.2) Butternut Squash Lasagna: A hearty and flavorful lasagna made with layers of butternut squash, ricotta cheese, and marinara sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Maple Glazed Carrots: Tender carrots glazed with a sweet and savory maple glaze.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Pumpkin Pie: A classic dessert made with pumpkin, evaporated milk, and spices, baked in a pie crust.
4.2) Sweet Potato Casserole: A delicious casserole made with sweet potatoes, brown sugar, and marshmallows, topped with a crispy pecan crumb topping.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Apple Cider: A warm and comforting drink made with apple juice, cinnamon, and sugar.
5.2) Pumpkin Spice Latte: A delicious and seasonal latte made with pumpkin spice, espresso, and milk.
 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th):
This week's menu features dishes that are rich and indulgent, perfect for a special occasion or a romantic dinner.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Escargot: A classic French appetizer made with cooked snails, garlic, parsley, and butter, served in their shells.
1.2) Foie Gras Torchon: A rich and decadent dish made with seared foie gras, served with toasted brioche and fig jam.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Filet Mignon: A tender and juicy cut of beef, served with a red wine reduction sauce.
2.2) Lobster Thermidor: A rich and indulgent dish made with lobster meat, egg yolks, and brandy, baked in a pastry shell.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Truffle Mac and Cheese: A luxurious and indulgent dish made with macaroni, cheese, and truffles.
3.2) Sauteed Spinach: A simple and healthy side dish made with sauteed spinach and garlic.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Memorial Day BBQ' on 09-03 with a special dish: Smoked Brisket.
1.3 Celebrate 'Mother's Day Meal' on 05-13 with a special dish: Eggs Benedict with Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.5 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 03-21 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Pasta Wednesdays' every 5 weeks starting from Week 18, serving: Spaghetti Carbonara.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that are hearty and warming, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Baked Brie: A wheel of brie cheese baked until melted and served with a fruit compote and baguette slices.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, slow-cooked stew made with beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with a crunchy streusel topping.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A rich and nutty pie made with pecans, corn syrup, and a flaky pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the hearty main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm and comforting drink made with rich cocoa and milk.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features dishes that are light and refreshing, perfect for those looking to detox after the holiday season.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with sea salt, a popular Japanese appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon fillets grilled to perfection and served with a citrusy glaze.
2.2) Quinoa Salad: A hearty salad made with quinoa, vegetables, and a tangy vinaigrette.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled until slightly charred and seasoned with olive oil and salt.
3.2) Roasted Beets: Roasted beets served with a tangy vinaigrette, a colorful and delicious side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Fruit Tart: A classic French dessert made with a tart shell and fresh fruit.
4.2) Sorbet: A refreshing and light dessert made with fruit and sugar, served in scoops or as a palate cleanser between courses.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp and refreshing white wine to pair with the light main courses.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A non-alcoholic option for those looking to stay hydrated and refreshed.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features dishes that are spicy and bold, perfect for those looking to add some excitement to their meals.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spicy Tuna Roll: A classic sushi roll made with spicy tuna, avocado, and cucumber.
1.2) Jalapeno Poppers: Jalapeno peppers stuffed with cream cheese and breadcrumbs, baked until golden and crispy.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chili Con Carne: A hearty and spicy stew made with beef, beans, and chili peppers.
2.2) Pad Thai: A popular Thai dish made with rice noodles, vegetables, and a spicy peanut sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Fried Rice: A flavorful side dish made with rice, vegetables, and scrambled eggs.
3.2) Sautéed Spinach: Sautéed spinach seasoned with garlic and chili flakes, a healthy and delicious side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chili Chocolate Cake: A decadent dessert made with chili peppers and rich chocolate.
4.2) Mango Sticky Rice: A sweet and spicy dessert made with mango, rice, and coconut milk.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Margaritas: A classic Mexican cocktail made with tequila, lime juice, and triple sec.
5.2) Sangria: A refreshing and fruity drink made with red wine, fruit, and brandy.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
This week's menu features a Seafood Season Extravaganza, showcasing the freshest and most delicious seafood dishes.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in lime juice, onions, and cilantro, served with tortilla chips.
1.2) Oysters on the Half Shell: Fresh oysters served on the half shell, accompanied by a mignonette sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Swordfish: Grilled swordfish served with a citrusy glaze and a side of quinoa.
2.2) Lobster Risotto: A rich and creamy risotto made with lobster meat and Arborio rice.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled until slightly charred and seasoned with olive oil and salt.
3.2) Sautéed Zucchini: Sautéed zucchini seasoned with garlic and lemon zest, a light and delicious side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Crème Brûlée: A classic French dessert made with cream, sugar, and a caramelized top.
4.2) Pineapple Upside-Down Cake: A delicious cake made with pineapple, brown sugar, and a buttery cake batter.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Champagne: A celebratory drink to accompany the Seafood Season Extravaganza.
5.2) Sangria: A refreshing and fruity drink to complement the seafood dishes.
 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th):
This week's menu features dishes that are cozy and comforting, perfect for those cold winter nights.

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Cinco de Mayo Fiesta' on 05-05 with a special dish: Tacos Al Pastor.

1.5 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 11-30 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.

- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Cherry Blossom Tea: A delicate blend of cherry blossom tea leaves, steeped to perfection and served hot.
1.2) Sushi Rolls with Cherry Blossom Petals: Fresh sushi rolls garnished with edible cherry blossom petals.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Cherry Blossom Salmon: Grilled salmon fillet glazed with a cherry blossom reduction sauce.
2.2) Cherry Blossom Tempura: Lightly battered and deep-fried seasonal vegetables, served with a cherry blossom dipping sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Cherry Blossom Rice: Fragrant jasmine rice infused with cherry blossom tea and garnished with petals.
3.2) Pickled Cherry Blossoms: Tart and sweet pickled cherry blossoms, adding a unique flavor to the meal.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Cherry Blossom Ice Cream: A scoop of delicate cherry blossom ice cream, swirled with a ribbon of cherry compote.
4.2) Cherry Blossom Macarons: Delicate French macarons filled with a cherry blossom ganache.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sake: A selection of premium sake to complement the cherry blossom flavors.
5.2) Cherry Blossom Martini: A refreshing cocktail made with cherry blossom syrup, vodka, and a splash of cranberry juice.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, and basil leaves drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with a flavorful tomato and basil mixture, drizzled with olive oil.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chicken Parmesan: Breaded and fried chicken cutlets topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese.
2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna: Layers of pasta, vegetables, and cheese baked to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Green Beans: Tender green beans sautéed with garlic and olive oil.
3.2) Roasted Vegetables: A medley of seasonal vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
4.2) Chocolate Lava Cake: A decadent dessert with a molten chocolate center, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A selection of bold red wines to complement the savory flavors of the meal.
5.2) Limoncello: A refreshing Italian lemon liqueur, perfect for sipping after dinner.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and melted cheese, served with pita chips.
1.2) Bruschetta with Prosciutto: Toasted bread topped with prosciutto, tomatoes, and a balsamic glaze.
2. Main Courses:

2.2) Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie: A vegetarian version of the classic dish, made with lentils, vegetables, and topped with mashed potatoes.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Creamy mashed sweet potatoes seasoned with cinnamon and nutmeg.
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Green beans sautéed with almonds and browned butter.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm and comforting dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar.
4.2) Chocolate Chip Cookies: Classic chocolate chip cookies, fresh from the oven.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes (continued)
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Cherry Blossom Spring Rolls: Lightly fried spring rolls filled with cherry blossom-infused pork and vegetables.
1.2) Cherry Blossom Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with cherry blossom salt.
2. Main Courses:

2.2) Cherry Blossom Sushi Roll: A special sushi roll filled with cherry blossom rice, avocado, and crab meat.
3. Side Dishes:

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-14 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, warm dip made with spinach, artichoke hearts, and garlic, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Portobello Mushrooms: Large portobello mushrooms marinated and grilled, served with a red wine reduction.
2.2) Vegan Lentil Shepherd's Pie: A hearty, plant-based pie filled with lentils, vegetables, and topped with mashed potatoes.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until caramelized and crispy, seasoned with garlic and lemon.
3.2) Quinoa Salad: A light, refreshing salad made with quinoa, mixed greens, avocado, and a citrus vinaigrette.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Vegan Chocolate Cake: A decadent, vegan chocolate cake made with almond milk and coconut oil, topped with a vegan chocolate ganache.
4.2) Fresh Fruit Tart: A vegan fruit tart made with a coconut crust and filled with a plant-based custard, topped with seasonal fruits.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Vegan Wines: A selection of vegan wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Vegan Beers: A variety of vegan beers to enjoy with the plant-based menu.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Crab Cakes: Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with breadcrumbs, Old Bay seasoning, and served with a tangy remoulade sauce.
1.2) Bruschetta: Grilled bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, garlic, and a drizzle of olive oil.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Pan-Seared Salmon: Fresh salmon cooked to perfection with a lemon butter sauce and served with asparagus.
2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna: Layers of pasta, marinara sauce, and a variety of vegetables, topped with a rich béchamel sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach sautéed with garlic and olive oil.
3.2) Garlic Roasted Potatoes: Potatoes roasted with garlic and herbs, seasoned with salt and pepper.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Crème Brûlée: A classic French dessert made with cream, sugar, and vanilla, topped with a caramelized sugar crust.
4.2) Apple Tarte Tatin: A French apple tart made by caramelizing apples in butter and sugar, then topping them with puff pastry and baking.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine White Wines: A selection of fine white wines to complement the lighter flavors of the meals.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing alternative to alcoholic beverages.

1.2) Goat Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with goat cheese, breadcrumbs, and herbs, baked until golden.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Independence Day Celebration' on 07-04 with a special dish: American Apple Pie.
1.2 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.3 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 02-07 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.4 Celebrate 'Oktoberfest Beer Dinner' on 10-06 with a special dish: Sausages and Sauerkraut.
1.5 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
2) Feature 'Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes' from Week 7 to Week 9 with dishes like: Cherry Blossom Tea and Sweets.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

2. Main Courses:

2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna: Layers of pasta, vegetables, and cheese baked to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-27 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.3 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 01-23 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Thanksgiving Dinner' on 11-22 with a special dish: Roast Turkey with Stuffing.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 9 to Week 10 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Dessert Sundays' every 3 weeks starting from Week 7, serving: Chocolate Lava Cake.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
